alert.note: Alert for McMinn; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 1:42PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Polk and southeastern McMinn Counties through 330 PM EDT... At 239 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Etowah, or 9 miles southeast of Athens, moving west at 10 mph. Another strong storm was located over northwest Polk County that was showing little movement. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Athens, Etowah, Englewood, Niota, Hiwassee Ocoee State Park and Dentville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
